Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that pelicans cool down by pushing spines out of their mouths.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that pelicans cannot eject their internal organs under any circumstances.
Falters at times: The claim falters by including a photo of a stork instead of a pelican.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is debunked by experts who explain the actual behavior of pelicans.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that pelicans cool down by pushing spines out of their mouths without providing any evidence or scientific explanation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim is refuted by experts who provide an alternative explanation that pelicans cool down by doing something akin to panting and stretching their necks.
